column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Skoog (Sweden): I would like to thank you,\r
#Text=Madam President, for your initiative in organizing\r
#Text=today's debate.
#Text=I have the honour to speak on behalf of the Nordic\r
#Text=countries of Denmark, Finland, Iceland and Norway\r
#Text=and my own country, Sweden.
#Text=First, I would like to thank the Special Representative\r
#Text=on Sexual Violence in Conflict, Ms.
#Text=Zainab Hawa\r
#Text=Bangura, for her statement and for her activities and\r
#Text=hard work.
#Text=I would also like to thank Ms.
#Text=Hamsatu\r
#Text=Allamin for her participation in today's meeting.
#Text=The role and influence of civil society in preventing\r
#Text=conflict, building peace and promoting human rights is\r
#Text=essential and it should be supported.
#Text=We warmly welcome the report of the Secretary-\r
#Text=General (S/2015/203) and its concrete and specific\r
#Text=recommendations on actions, and we commend Special\r
#Text=Representative Bangura and her Office for their work in\r
#Text=this regard.
#Text=I would also like to commend the Team of\r
#Text=\r
#Text=Experts on Rule of Law and Sexual Violence in Conflict\r
#Text=in strengthening the capacities of States to address such\r
#Text=violence, but despite rising recognition and attention to\r
#Text=this issue, the picture is appalling.
#Text=Nothing less than\r
#Text=zero tolerance is acceptable in this area.
#Text=The fight to prevent and eradicate conflict-related\r
#Text=sexual Violence must be pursued on several levels.
#Text=These crimes do not emerge in a vacuum; they take\r
#Text=place against a backdrop of structural, gender-based\r
#Text=discrimination.
#Text=Sexual violence is a reflection of\r
#Text=gender inequalities.
#Text=Therefore, a systematic and broad\r
#Text=gender approach, which includes increasing women's\r
#Text=empowerment through political participation and\r
#Text=influence, strengthening women's economic rights and\r
#Text=empowerment, promoting and protecting sexual and\r
#Text=reproductive health and rights, improving women's\r
#Text=and girls' security and furthering the education of\r
#Text=women and girls, needs to be applied.
#Text=These issues are\r
#Text=fundamental.
#Text=I would like to raise three more points.
#Text=First,\r
#Text=measures dealing with the consequences of sexual\r
#Text=violence need to be stepped up.
#Text=Assistance to survivors\r
#Text=and witnesses, including sexual and reproductive health\r
#Text=services and psychosocial, legal and livelihood support,\r
#Text=is crucial, as was stressed by my Colombian colleague.
#Text=It is urgent that we take further concrete steps to ensure\r
#Text=accountability and end impunity, as many around this\r
#Text=table have said today.
#Text=We welcome and support the\r
#Text=efforts of the Chief Prosecutor of the International\r
#Text=Criminal Court and the ongoing work of Justice Rapid\r
#Text=Response and UN-Women for enhancing the capacity\r
#Text=to investigate sexual and gender-based violent crimes\r
#Text=which deny women and girls their human rights.
#Text=Secondly, there is a growing recognition that men\r
#Text=should be involved to a larger extent in the work in\r
#Text=favour of gender equality, as it cannot be left to women\r
#Text=alone.
#Text=There is a need to look at the impact of masculine\r
#Text=identities on gender inequality, conflict and Violence.
#Text=Evidence suggests that violent notions of masculinity\r
#Text=not only perpetuate gender-based violence but can also\r
#Text=fuel armed conflict, while more positive notions of\r
#Text=masculinity could be instrumental in promoting peace.
#Text=Thirdly, we note the rise of violent extremism and\r
#Text=terrorism, which are often built on perceptions that\r
#Text=deny women their enjoyment of human rights.
#Text=More\r
#Text=attention on the human rights of women is therefore\r
#Text=needed, particularly in the context of terrorism and\r
#Text=counter-terrorism, especially with regard to the specific\r
#Text=consequences of violent extremism on women's and\r
#Text=girls' rights.
#Text=Sexual violence and the denial of rights\r
#Text=and freedoms, including the right to control their\r
#Text=sexuality and reproduction, are integral to the ideology\r
#Text=of extremist groups and used as part of a strategy to\r
#Text=spread terror, persecute ethnic, religious and sexual\r
#Text=minorities, and suppress whole communities that\r
#Text=oppose these groups' ideology.
#Text=It is clearly a tactic of\r
#Text=terror and needs to be addressed in the international\r
#Text=community's response.
#Text=We therefore welcome the\r
#Text=recommendation that efforts to prevent and address\r
#Text=sexual violence and promote human rights of women\r
#Text=should be closely and strategically aligned with efforts\r
#Text=to prevent Violent extremism.
#Text=Conflict-related sexual\r
#Text=violence should be a topic fully integrated into the work\r
#Text=of relevant Security Council sanctions committees.
#Text=Women protection advisers and gender advisers\r
#Text=have a central role to play in ensuring competence\r
#Text=and knowledge in order for United Nations missions\r
#Text=to meet actual needs in the field.
#Text=A11 missions should\r
#Text=have a gender adviser with a sufficiently high level\r
#Text=of authority and who should work directly with the\r
#Text=mission leadership.
#Text=Gender advisers, gender focal\r
#Text=points and women protection advisers should be funded\r
#Text=from the regular budget.
#Text=Nevertheless, the ultimate\r
#Text=responsibility to secure the gender dimension naturally\r
#Text=lies with the leadership of the mission.
#Text=The Nordic countries are firm supporters, including\r
#Text=financially, of United Nations Action Against Sexual\r
#Text=Violence in Conflict.
#Text=We believe that United Nations\r
#Text=Action makes the United Nations system work in a\r
#Text=more holistic and coordinated way.
#Text=Lastly, the important role of media and civil society,\r
#Text=including women's rights organizations, should not be\r
#Text=underestimated.
#Text=We need to draw on their knowledge\r
#Text=and experience and recognize the pivotal role they play\r
#Text=in changing social norms, attitudes and behaviours and\r
#Text=help ensure that women's rights are upheld and that\r
#Text=their voices are fully heard.
